title: Hyde5: Zach Brown makes sense for Dolphins
text:
Hyde5: Zach Brown makes sense for Dolphins Caption Dolphins free agency analysis - Defense 
Chris Perkins and Omar Kelly offer their thoughts on the Miami Dolphins' moves on defense during free agency.

Omar Kelly and Chris Perkins offer their thoughts on the Miami Dolphins' moves on offense during the early part of free agency. 
Omar Kelly and Chris Perkins offer their thoughts on the Miami Dolphins' moves on offense during the early part of free agency. Caption Dolphins and Adam Gase sticking to alpha male theme 
Dolphins coach Adam Gase likes alpha males, and those are the type of players he's trying to retain and acquire. 
Dolphins coach Adam Gase likes alpha males, and those are the type of players he's trying to retain and acquire. Caption Dolphins sign linebacker Lawrence Timmons and offensive lineman Ted Larsen 
The Miami Dolphins have addressed two of the their most pressing needs, landing veteran inside linebacker Lawrence Timmons and offensive lineman Ted Larsen. 
The Miami Dolphins have addressed two of the their most pressing needs, landing veteran inside linebacker Lawrence Timmons and offensive lineman Ted Larsen. Caption Omar Kelly and Chris Perkins on Dolphins' free-agent moves 
Omar Kelly and Chris Perkins analyze the latest Dolphins' moves in free agency. 
Omar Kelly and Chris Perkins analyze the latest Dolphins' moves in free agency. Dave Hyde and the Dolphins seem a fit. Whether it works out remains to play out. Brown visited the team last night, and there’s no word that meeting ended, suggesting this is an over-night camp stay.
At some point, this is about money, and there’s a simple way to do that from the Dolphins side: Release Koa Misi to free up $4.2 million and transfer that money to Brown’s bank account. 
Easy, right? 
Brown would check off another item on my Dolphins’ to-do list this off-season. But there are a couple of things they’d have to be satisfied with in signing him. The first one is tactical from what would be an improved linebacking corps. Namely, how do the talents and positions of Brown, Lawrence Timmons and Kiko Alonso complement each other? 
All three played inside last year (Brown and Timmons in 3-4 defenses in Buffalo and Pittsburgh, respectively). Brown did play outside in 2012 and 2013 in Tennessee. New Dolphins linebacker coach Frank Bush coached Brown as a rookie in 2012. 
Can Brown run like he did playing outside for Tennessee? He had three interceptions (two returned for touchdowns), 5.5 sacks and 93 tackles as a rookie. After another good year in 2013, he was hurt in 2014 (pectoral tear) and played only five games in 2015. 
That led to a show-me year last year with Buffalo. Moved to the inside, he had 149 tackles, four sacks, four passes defensed and two forced fumbles. 
Upgrade? No doubt. His health and contract desires are crucial to any signing. The Dolphins and Brown felt good enough after meeting Monday to evidently not end it. We’ll see what Tuesday brings. 
2. The Jets didn’t fall for the trap in signing Jay Cutler. Too bad. That could’ve been highly entertaining. Instead, they actually made a smart move with 37-year-old Chris McCown. He’s a solid, stop-gap veteran who, if he stays healthy, can be a bridge to whoever is tomorrow. The contract is for $6 million with a comical $5 million in incentives if this rebuilding team makes the playoffs. 
3.Glad our national nightmare is over and the FBI found Tom Brady’s jersey. Not that the FBI had anything to do recently. 
4.Best wishes to Jelani Jenkins, one of the good guys, in Oakland. 
5.
